title: How Alibaba could challenge China's music streaming king
text:
Hong Kong (CNN Business) Tencent (TCEHY) dominates music streaming in China. Now rival tech titan Alibaba (BABA) is forging an alliance that could help it knock the leader down a peg.

NetEase NTES Alibaba is picking up a minority stake inCloud Music, a freemium streaming service, for $700 million

Alibaba already owns its own music streaming app called Xiami. And the company has partnered with NetEase in the past to share music libraries

significantly strengthens the relationship between the two — and that could be bad news for Tencent Music TME But the latest deal, announced Thursday,significantly strengthens the relationship between the two — and that could be bad news for, Citi Research analysts wrote in a research note on Friday.

the market through its Tencent Music had 652 million monthly active users and 31 million paying subscribers in the three months to June 30. The social networking giant has developed a stronghold inthe market throughits popular streaming platforms QQ Music, KuGou and Kuwo.

description: Tencent dominates music streaming in China. Now rival tech titan Alibaba is forging an alliance that could help it knock the leader down a peg.
